review_body: This ancient door of the city has been rebuild in a close suburb on new foundations (close to the Inter Burgo Hotel, not where it is indicated on the T.Adv. map). It is a classical Korean architecture, quite spectacular, especially at night, but not exceptional. Worth a look if you pass by otherwise no need for a detour.
We spent about 20 minutes here walking through the park which is tucked away in an industrial area surrounded by trees. The view of the temple at night was fantastic.
